Package graph.partitioning

Package defines interfaces and implements algorithms for graph and hyper-graph partitioning.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    HObjFncIntf
    defines the methods to be used by any class that will implement an objective function measure of a partition of a hyper-graph.
    HPartitionerIntf  
    ObjFncIntf  
    PartitionerIntf  
    SPPMakerIntf  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    CutEdgesObjFnc  
    HObjFncSOED  
    HPartitioner2LSPP
    this class implements a 2-level (high-level) partitioning scheme: First, the graph is partitioned among a small number of components (using hMeTiS or any other partitioner), and each component is then partitioned among a corresponding number of components.
    HPartitionerGKW  
    HPartitionerMLSPP2
    implements multi-level partitioning of hyper-graphs.
    HPartRunner  
    PartitionerGK  
    PartitionerGKW  
    PartitionerGKWR  
    PartitionerGKWR.CC  
    SPP2MPSWriterUtil  
    SPPMaker4HG
    creates SPPMakerIntf objects that set-up the A matrix and c cost vector in a set partitioning problem (SPP) of n variables of the form min c'x such that Ax=e, x Binary.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    PartitioningException  

Package graph.partitioning Description

Package defines interfaces and implements algorithms for graph and hyper-graph partitioning.

Package Specification

The PartitionerIntf and HPartitionerIntf classes define the interfaces that must be implemented by any class that will implement a partitioning algorithm (for plain graphs or hyper-graphs, respectively). The ObjFncIntf (and HObjFncIntf) classes define the interfaces for the objective function that will be minimized by any partitioning algorithm, and the CutEdgesObjFnc class implements the most common metric in graph partitioning namely the sum of weights of total cut-edges (the HObjFncSOED implements the Sum-Of-External-Degrees metric, commonly used in hyper-graph partitioning for VLSI CAD). The PartitionerXXX and HPartitionerXXX classes implement various partitioning algorithms (including heuristics inspired from the Fidducia-Matheyes algorithm).
  • hyperlink
